results.title: The Country Roads Board gazette No. 10
results.brief_description: Progress report on work of the Country Roads Board; rebuilding the Warrigal Road and the Nepean Highway intersection; new road bridge across the Maribyrnong River at Footscray; construction of a new Air Force air strip; digging storm water drains in the metropolitan areas; maintenance and building of country roads and bridges.

results.title: Cornering and overtaking
results.creator_credit: John Edwards, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “How to Drive”.
Demonstrates by high angle photography, graphics and animation how certain forces are set in motion when we change direction in a car. Safe methods of cornering, positioning and overtaking are shown, and points of courtesy and common sense in each case are noted.

results.title: The Conquest of the Pacific
results.creator_credit: Government of the Commonwealth of Australia
results.brief_description: A record of the arrival of Kingsford-Smith and Ulm at Brisbane on 9th June 1928, after their first successful flight across the Pacific and their official welcome in Sydney including Kingsford Smith’s broadcast greeting to the people.

results.title: The Cattle story
results.brief_description: Classroom film on the Northern Australian export beef industry. Historical survey shows introduction of beef cattle to Australia by Governor Phillip. Gives detailed account of beef-raising areas, stock routes and mustering procedures, and indicates importance of the industry in Australia’s economy. Adoption of modern transport methods, in particular, has done much to raise the quality of Australian beef. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.
results.description: Classroom film on the Northern Australian export beef industry. Historical survey shows introduction of beef cattle to Australia by Governor Phillip. results.title: The Case for books
results.creator_credit: Rhonda Small, Henry Lewes, Malcolm Otton and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Library services in Australia. Shows briefly some of the work of the Commonwealth Parliamentary Library, the National Library with its varied resources, and examples of State, University, special and public services suggesting their value in meeting needs for information at all levels.

results.title: The Car behind
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Advises on the precautions to be taken when driving in front of another vehicle, including procedures for overtaking, increasing the distance between cars, and the use of brake lights, traffic indicators, and hand signals. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Car ahead
results.creator_credit: Commonwealth Department of Transport, Film Australia and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Skills of Defensive Driving”.
Demonstrates the reaction time between a signal to brake and the application of the brake by the driver. Advises on precautions to be taken when following another vehicle. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Calling Sydney Harbour
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Otton, Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Shows aspects of the commerce on Sydney Harbour. Also reveals the changing face of Sydney from the tugboats that work in the port.

results.title: Cairns
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Life in Australia”.
Describes the daily life, scenery and products of Cairns, a small city situated in the tropical far north of Queensland.

results.title: By-pass
results.creator_credit: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A short film illustrating a typical administrative problem for discussion. Two office workers produce innovative designs that may prove to have long range cost-saving benefits. Neither of their superiors appears to be appreciative. One designer decides to by-pass his approach to his superior. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Arch Nicholson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
